textsPage.textAboutme: With three years of training, including one year of hands-on experience, I have specialized in UX/UI using Atomic Design. I have participated in job simulations, collaborating in teams of up to six people. In addition, I have worked on commissioned projects. Combined with my back-end knowledge, I am ready to join a professional team.

actualProjects.title: Soy-Luky
actualProjects.description: Currently, at OpenLabs, I am developing Soy-Luky, a product that integrates rent payments with credit cards through Mercado Pago and property collection in one place.

ShareIt.title: ShareIt
description: On the official website of the ShareIt community, I participated in the refactoring and scaling of the platform.
I improved the visibility of the main access, automated the group registration process, and implemented entry validations with a 2-step access flow.
Additionally, I optimized the user interface and contributed to the notification system.

EliasVelazquez.title: Personal Brand Website – Elias Velazquez
description: This website was built from scratch for a client with the goal of strengthening and enhancing their personal brand.

The entire project was designed and developed from the ground up, including visual identity, logo, and UI design, all aligned with the color palette and style of the client’s existing digital products.

Beyond a clean and professional visual approach, the site features elegant animations and a highly scalable content system powered by Astro Content Collections, allowing seamless content updates without breaking the visual structure.

Working on this project was both exciting and meaningful, as it allowed full creative freedom, experimentation, and attention to detail, resulting in a polished user experience that fully met the client’s expectations.

Lucio Aquino.title: Lucio Aquino
description: : I developed the official website of Lucio Misael Aquino, a programmer with over 10 years of experience in the video game development industry.
The site serves as an artistic representation of his career, featuring sections such as introduction, projects, about me, and contact.

It includes multiple animations, gamer-focused branding with RGB effects, a video game selection simulation with a characteristic console sound, and hidden references based on the client’s personal interests.

ATSfor-ShareIT.title: ATSfor-ShareIT
description: Collaborated in resolving functional and visual bugs of the open-source platform belonging to ShareIT, improving the design
and functionality of the website by modifying existing code and creating key features from scratch, completely redesigning its interface
taking into account the previous design, while implementing changes to reflect the brand identity and enhance the UX.

inAudio.title: In-Audio
description: This project is currently in the first of four planned stages.
Its current functionality is to deliver uninterrupted music by retrieving tracks from the Jamendo API through a custom backend.
This backend handles both the reception and distribution of information to the front end, as well as securely storing the API key.

Urbania.title: Urbania
description: This project was developed during my final job simulation at No Country.
I served as a Front-End Developer and also took on the role of Team Lead, coordinating tasks, promoting efficient componentization, and enhancing the application's overall performance.
I collaborated with the UX/UI designer, suggesting visual improvements that enhanced the user experience.
I also implemented animations using Framer Motion, creating a more appealing and fluid interface.

WordRank.title: WordRank
description: This application was developed after completing my first job simulation at No Country.
I felt the need to strengthen my API consumption skills, so I approached this as a personal challenge.

The platform allows users to search, filter, and sort countries using a public API. It displays a dynamic results counter and detailed views for each country, including navigation between neighboring countries.
I implemented lazy loading to optimize performance and refine my skills in efficient rendering.

HuellitasEnCasa.title: Huellitas En Casa
description: This project was developed during my first job simulation at No Country, where I worked as the UX/UI designer and Front-End lead.
I was in charge of the full design and layout of the platform, focusing on delivering a smooth and intuitive user experience.
The application allowed both users and shelters to register and log in; shelters could upload and manage pet information.
It was my first practical experience working with APIs, marking the beginning of my transition from design to development.

AzzAEdusync.title: AzzAEdusync
description: , a minimalistic and responsive web platform for students and self-learners that centralizes all study organization in one place.
It allows users to create thematic sections, add reminders, and plan sessions using a monthly calendar.
It features a rich text editor for notes, PDF upload and export, a daily task manager, and a section for saving useful links.
All data is stored locally in the browser, with the option to export notes as a PDF for backup.

ClassRun.title: ClassRun
description: This project was developed during my second job simulation at No Country, where I worked as a Front-End Developer.
One of the biggest challenges was adapting to technologies I hadn't used before, such as Next.js, Shadcn, and TypeScript—tools chosen due to the team's architectural decisions.
Over the five-week simulation, I focused on quickly integrating into the team and delivering effective solutions, even as several teammates dropped out.
I completed the experience with a fully functional Front-End that implemented global state management using Context API.
The application focuses on academic management, allowing teachers and tutors to monitor subjects and students individually.

CodigoDelMar.title: Codigo Del Mar
description: This was a commissioned professional project to create a landing page aimed at enhancing the online presence of the 'Programadores de Mar del Plata' team.
the design focused on conveying brand identity through a simple yet attractive aesthetic, clearly showcasing their services and experience.
It includes a validated contact form to facilitate direct communication with potential clients.
The project is currently on hold until the clients finalize the content for its official deployment.

Acme.title: Acme
description: Website developed by following the official Next.js documentation, where I learned to
handle the framework's native routing, implement authentication, and work with server-side rendering (SSR).
It includes a CRUD system for invoices and real-time data visualization
using a PostgreSQL database.
